metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5285 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A Null pointer dereference vulnerability exists in Mozilla Network Security Services due to a missing NULL check in PK11_SignWithSymKey / ssl3_ComputeRecordMACConstantTime, which could let a remote malicious user cause a Denial of Service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libnss3-1d - 2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libnss3-tools - 2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream bug, this was fixed in 3.25, but patch for 3.21 fixes it differently.

criterions.comment: nss package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
